intro: Sageretia theezans var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smoothleaf sageretia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape and have a smooth, glabrous surface. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy areas.
